newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: South African robbers douse bank staff with petrol.
newsitem.headline: South African robbers douse bank staff with petrol.

text.p: Armed robbers on Wednesday doused seven bank staff with petrol and threatened to set them on fire before escaping with a substantial amount of cash, South African police said.

The robbery in the trendy Johannesburg suburb of Melville started before opening time when a man wearing a shirt and tie resembling bank-issued clothing was let into the bank by employees who thought he was a colleague.
"The suspect walked to a counter, producted a pistol and announced that he was from the 'Bank Robbers' Association'," police inspector Mark Reynolds said in a statement.
The gunman let two accomplices in and the trio doused staff with petrol to dissuade them from calling police and forced them to open the safe.
Reynolds said the robbers fled with "substantial" cash but declined to give the value. The staff were locked in the safe.
South Africa's crime wave, which has helped scare off tourists and foreign investors, has eased since 1995 but remains high. Figures show 1.8 million crimes were reported last year.
